Package gui

Class Travelerhomepagecontroller

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.Travelerhomepagecontroller
  • public class Travelerhomepagecontroller
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller class for managing interactions on the Traveler Home Page GUI. Handles actions such as creating a new order, viewing orders,,deleting orders logging out, and exiting the application.
    Author:
    Nadine Halabi, Bassel Haddad, Asaad Sajim

      Handles the action event when the "Exit" button is clicked.

    • Method Detail

      • createNewOrderBtn

        public void createNewOrderBtn​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Handles the action event when the "Create New Order" button is clicked. Navigates to the create order page.
        Parameters:
        event - The action event triggered by clicking the "Create New Order" button.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs while navigating to the create order page.

      • showOrdersButton

        public void showOrdersButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Handles the action event when the "Show Orders" button is clicked. Displays the list of orders.
        Parameters:
        event - The action event triggered by clicking the "Show Orders" button.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs while displaying the list of orders.

      • logoutB

        public void logoutB​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Handles the action event when the "Logout" button is clicked. Logs out the traveler and returns to the login page.
        Parameters:
        event - The action event triggered by clicking the "Logout" button.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs while logging out.

      • editcurrentordersBtn

        public void editcurrentordersBtn​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Handles the action event when the "Edit Current Orders" button is clicked. Navigates to the delete order list page.
        Parameters:
        event - The action event triggered by clicking the "Edit Current Orders" button.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs while navigating to the delete order list page.

      • exitButton

        public void exitButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent action)
        Handles the action event when the "Exit" button is clicked. Logs out the traveler and exits the application.
        Parameters:
        action - The action event triggered by clicking the "Exit" button.
